goal.tools.mc.program.goal.trans

Class TauAnalyzer<T extends Term,A extends Atom,U extends Update>

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.tools.mc.program.goal.trans.TauAnalyzer<T,A,U>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of term associated with the KRT that the agent to analyze uses.
    A - The type of atom associated with the KRT that the agent to analyze uses.
    U - The type of update associated with the KRT that the agent to analyze uses.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PrologTauAnalyzer

    public abstract class TauAnalyzer<T extends Term,A extends Atom,U extends Update>
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a transition analysis tool set consisting of slicing and partial order reduction methods. This works only for flat agents, i.e. agents that do not have nested modules.
    Author:
    Sungshik

      Indicates which heuristic for ample set computation should be used.

    • Field Detail

      • ample

        public static int ample
        Indicates which heuristic for ample set computation should be used. At current, two heuristics have been implemented.
        1. Every transition class is considered in isolation.
        2. Connected components in the dependence graph are sought.

      • isVisible

        protected abstract boolean isVisible(TauClass<T,A,U> tauClass,
                MscSet voc)
        Determines whether the specified transition class is visible to the specified set of mental state conditions.
        Parameters:
        tauClass - - The transition class to check visibility for.
        voc - - The mental state conditions to which the specified transition class might be visible.
        Returns:
        true if the specified transition class is visible; false otherwise.

      • por

        public java.util.List<GOALState> por(GOALState source,
                            GOALMentalStateConverter conv,
                            LMHashSet<State> path,
                            Agent<IDEGOALInterpreter> agent)
        Runs the partial order reduction algorithm to determine the successors of the specified mental state. The algorithm is based on the ample set methods, and tries to find a set of all the successors that is sufficient for model checking results to be preserved. Assumes an NDFS search regime of the state space.
        Parameters:
        source - - The state whose successors are requested.
        conv - - The mental state converter.
        path - - The current search path of the nested depth-first search algorithm.
        agent - the agent performing the action.
